Data Structures

struct  IconElem

Detailed Description

An icon set specifies a variable number of icons, which are related to a specific icon state (e. g. disabled or active). Each icon set has at least a default icon, which represents the icon state with the size IconState::DefaultSize and the mode IconState::NormalMode.

It is strongly recommend not to use images for the icon set which require an expensive decoding like PNG, JPEG, GIF or WBMP. The reason is that each time the state of an icon changes the image must be decoded, which might decrease the performance and leads to a weak GUI responsiveness. It is recommended to use icons which are instances of the classes Bitmap, NativeImage or any other kind of image where Image::DecodeSynchronously() returns TRUE.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN IconSet::AddIcon (  const IconState &  state,
const ImageObtainer &  icon
) 
 

Adds the icon icon for the state defined by state. TRUE is returned, if the icon could be added successfully. If FALSE is returned, either an icon has already been added for the state or not enough memory has been available.

const ImageObtainer& IconSet::GetDefaultIcon (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the default icon, which will be used for the icon state with the size IconState::DefaultSize and the mode IconState::NormalMode.

const ImageObtainer & IconSet::GetIcon (  INT  index  )  const
 

Returns the icon for the given index. The maximum index can be retrieved by IconSet::GetIconCount.

const ImageObtainer & IconSet::GetIcon (  const IconState &  state  )  const
 

Returns the icon for the state state.

INT IconSet::GetIconCount (   )  const
 

Returns the number of icons including the default icon.

void IconSet::RemoveAllIcons (   ) 
 

Removes all icons including the default icon.

void IconSet::SetDefaultIcon (  const ImageObtainer &  icon  )  [inline]
 

Sets the default icon, which will be used for the icon state with the size IconState::DefaultSize and the mode IconState::NormalMode.

BOOLEAN IconSet::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Parses the uri for name/value pairs and sets the icons accordingly. The URI format for IconSet property for resource URIs is <uri>!<default icon="" id>="">{;<size>,<mode>=<icon id>="">} e.g. ffs:/test.rc!45;0,0=1111;1,0=2111;2,0=3111;0,1=4111;0,2=5111;1,1=6111;1,2=7111;2,1=8111;2,2=9111

for file URIs file:/<path to="" default="" icon>="">{;<size>,<mode>=<path to="" icon>="">} e.g. file:/c:/1.gif;0,0=c:/2.gif;0,1=c:/3.gif

Size codes: 0 = Small, 1 = Default, 2 = Large Mode codes: 0 = Normal, 1 = Active, 2 = Disabled

Returns:
TRUE if setting icons had no errors, FALSE otherwise.
